title: How Zéfal is redefining on-bike storage options

How Zéfal is redefining on-bike storage options

Keeping on top of supplies and kit on the bike can be as important to the outcome of a longer ride as the condition of the legs powering the cranks. Forgetting a vital tool, undercooking your fuelling or neglecting to pack a shiver-saving windbreaker can hamstring even the best-intentioned cyclist on an adventure.

But gone are the days of overstuffed jersey pockets or – lord forbid – backpacks. Riders today can rely on well-researched and thoughtfully designed on-bike cargo solutions which take into account pretty much every consideration you could think of.

Yes it’s important for your luggage to be dry, secure, easy to access and not contained in something oppressively heavy – but not at the expense of frame rub or ugly aesthetics. Luckily, bike storage has come a long way in a short space of time, and it’s now an easy-to-solve problem.

French brand Zéfal, well-recognised and firmly established in producing accessories for all cycling disciplines, has launched its Z Road and Z Adventure cargo bags to help keep your packing totally streamlined and effective. Every type of ride is covered.

Whether it’s just a 50km spin around your local lanes where a saddle bag is a necessity, or a gravel-led adventure requiring coverage for a few more potential disasters, the different Zéfal bags offer lots of options.

Zéfal Z Road Pack and Z Off-Road Pack

For a modern, carefully designed and practical example, take Zéfal’s Z Road Pack and the Z Off-Road Pack saddle bags. Both combine sensible and subtle aesthetics with deeply practical touches to ensure that riding essentials are taken care of – whatever the weather and the road throws at you.

The exterior is fully waterproof thanks to the TPU polyester material, as is the zipper, and you can carry up to one kilo’s worth of kit even on the bumpiest of riding surfaces. Both bags are lightweight at just 85/90g, can handle a good deal of rough treatment and are compatible with any standard saddle, thanks to the self-gripping Velcro straps.

As the name suggests, the Z Road Pack is designed for road bike tubes. Its dimensions allow it to accommodate any tube up to 700 x 32c. In comparison, the larger Z Off-Road Pack can accommodate a 29in x 2.5in tube.  

Zéfal is confident that riders can store not only a tube, but also, levers, a multitool and a CO2 cartridge and inflator in each bag, with handy separate compartments to protect your inner tube from your pointy multitool and make sure you know where your gear is when you need it.

Zéfal Z Adventure T1

When riding adventures get longer and your legs need more consistent fuelling, having easy access to your fuel is paramount. That’s where the Z Adventure T1 comes in. Constructed with three Velcro straps to lock it in position and minimise leg-rub, the T1 provides the ideal stash point for snacks, powerbanks, bank cards and other often-used necessities. An access channel for cables has been fixed into the bag’s central chamber to keep everything both organised and powered while riding.

If your bike has bento box top tube mount points, then the Z Adventure T1 Bolt can take advantage of this added security and minimise the risk of any paintwork abrasion. With a full range of bolt mounts fitted in its undercarriage, the T1 bolt does away with two Velcro straps, creating a super-clean look and secure installation. Both bags can house up to 1kg of cargo which should be more than enough to keep you loaded up with electrical juice and calories.

Zéfal Z Adventure F1

Completing Zéfal’s light cargo system is the Z Adventure F1 bar bag, which slips in neatly between your bike’s head tube and stem while still offering a 1.2l capacity and up to 2kg of storage. For added versatility, this water-repellant bag has Velcro straps, so that it can be mounted on near enough any handlebar.

As well as a red-lined inner to help with locating your kit, a front-mounted bungee rope expands the bag’s capacity externally. It’s a useful spot for stuffing a rain shell on days when changeable weather keeps you guessing.

The Adventure F1 is for the paths and lanes less travelled too. A locking drawcord adds an additional layer of security for when surfaces degrade, while the TPU material is tough and durable without being bulky. The bag’s total weight is a very competitive 130g.

All in all, the range takes advantage of all the main mounting points available on a road or gravel bike, and uses them as sites for svelte, stylish storage. Having spent over 100 years producing accessories for all kinds of cyclists, Zéfal has all the experience required to keep you riding.
